gurmukhi: rUp auhI pt ky rMg hY vh rMg vhY sB hI bCrw ko ] swNiJ prI su gey hir jI giH koie lKY ieqno bl kwko ]
transliteration: Roop Uhipat Ke Ran Hai Vah Ran Vahai Sabh Hibachhraa Ko|| Saanjh(i) Parisu Gad Har(i) Jigrah(i) Koe Lakhai Itno Bal Kaako||
translation: The same forms the same garments and exactly the same colour of the calves, when evening fell, Krishna returned to his home; who is there to adjudge his power?

gurmukhi: mwq ipqw su lKy n lKy iek Awd ko nwm mnI mn jwko ] bwq iehI smJI mn mY ieh hY Ab Kyl smwpiq vwNko ]179]
transliteration: Maat Pitaa Su Lakhe Na Lakhe Ik Aad Ko Naam Maniman Jaako|| Baat Ehisamjhiman Mai Eh Hai Ab Khel Samaapat(i) Vaanko||179||
translation: Brahma thought that the parents would, seeing all this, understand the whole thing and the game of Krishna would now be finished.179.

gurmukhi: cUm lXo jsuDw suq ko isr kwnH bjwie auTy murlI qo ] bwl lKy Apno n iknI jn god vrI iqh so ihq kIjo ]
transliteration: Choom Layo Jasudhaa Sout Ko Sir Kaahn Bajaae Outhe Mrulito|| Baal Lakhe Apno Na Kinijan God Varitih So Hit Keejo||
translation: When Krishna played on his flute, Yashoda kissed his head and none other paid attention to his boy; they all loved Krishna;

gurmukhi: hoq kulwhl pY biRj mY nih hoq ieqY su khUM ikm bIqo ] gwvq gIq sny hir gwrn loh blwie bDU biRj kIso ]180]
transliteration: Hot Kulaahal Pai Brij Mai Nah(i) Hot Itai Su Kahoon Kim Beeto|| Gadvat Geet Sane Har(i) Gadran Leh Balaae Badhoo Brij Keeso||180||
translation: Whatever tumult is there in Braja, such a tumult is not there at any other place; it is not being known how the time is passing; Krishna began to sing songs with gopis alongwith the newly married women.180.

gurmukhi: pRwq Bey hir jI auT kY bn bIc gey sMg lYkr b`Cy ] gwvq gIq iPrwvq hY Ctkw gih gÍwr sBY kr h`Cy ]
transliteration: Praat Bhae Har(i) Jiouth Kai Ban Beech Gad San Laikar Bachchhe|| Gadvat Geet Phiraavat Hai Chhatkaa Gadh Gvaar Sabhai Kar Hachche||
translation: When the day dawned, Krishna again went to the forest taking the calves with him; he saw there all the gopa boys singing songs and twirling their clubs;

gurmukhi: Kylq Kylq nMd ko nMd su Awp hI qo igr ko auT g`Cy ] koaU khY ieh Kyd ghy hm koaU khYN ieh nwhin n`Cy ]181]
transliteration: Khelat Khelat Nand Ko Nand Ko Nand Su Aap Hito Gir Ko Outh Gadhchhe|| Ko( i)  Kahai Eh Khed Gade Ham Ko( i)  Kahain Eh Naahan(i) Nachchhe||181||
translation: Continuing the play, Krishna went towards the mountain; someone said that Krishna was angry with them and someone said tht he was unwell.181.

gurmukhi: hoie iekqR sny hir gÍwrn lY Apny sMig pY sB gweI ] dyiK iqnY igr ky isr qy mn moih bFwie sBY auiT DweI ]
transliteration: Hoe Ikatra Sane Har(i) Gvaaran Lai Apne San(i) Pai Sabh Gadee|| Dekh(i) Tinai Gir Ke Sir Te Man Moh(i) Badhaae Sabhai Outh(i) Dhaaee||
translation: Krishna moved on with the boys and the cows; seeing them on the top of the mountain all ran towards them; gopas also went towards them;

gurmukhi: gop gey iqn pY cl kY jb jwq ipKI iqn nYnn mweI ] roh Bry su Kry n try suq nMdih ky bhu bwq sunweI ]182]
transliteration: Gop Gad Tin Pai Chal Kai Jab Jaat Pikhitin Nainan Maaee|| Roh Bharesu Kdare Na Dare Sout Nandah(i) Ke Babu Baat Sounaaee||182||
translation: Yashoda also saw this spectacle; Krishna was standing there in anger without moving; and all these people told; many things to Krishna.182.
Speech of Nand addressed to Krishna:

gurmukhi: ikau suq gaUAn ilAwie iehwN ieh qY hmro sB hI dD KoXo ] cUG gey bCrw ien ko ieh qy hmrY mn mY BRm hoXo ]
transliteration: Kio Sout Gadoan Liaae Thaan Eh Tai Hamro Sabh Hidadh Khoyo|| Choogh Gad Bachhraa In Ko Eh Te Hamrai Man Mai Bhram Hoyo||
translation: “O son ! why have you brought the cows here? In this way, the production of milk for us has declined; all the calves have drunk their milk and this illusion persists in our mind;”
